channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bag of wet cardboard left in middle of pavement, 27th November
item.description:
Bromley recycling refuse collectors left a large bag of wet cardboard in the middle of the pavement which is dangerous. If they won’t take it, why can’t they put back onto the drive that they took it from? It’s dangerous and it would have caused more litter?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southill Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Maintenance / Repairs Issue problem has been found, 27th November

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Meeson Street, Hackney, London

item.title: TREE O/S No 10 THE BRANCH ON TREE HAS SNAPPED, 27th November
item.description:
Resident reporting opposite her house No 10 there is a tree that was half trimmed a couple of months ago half of & now there is a broken hanging branch left swinging on this tree it will fall and can hurt pedestrians, animals & children, it is not low enough for someone to pull at it. The branch is to high it will hurt someone please could someone look into this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Matfield Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
